author: mklement0
body:
If you pass an extant type that happens to have _no type data associated with it_, the error message misleadingly suggests that no such _type exists_.

Steps to reproduce
------------------

```powershell
# Pass a type that clearly exists, but happens to have no associated type date.
Remove-TypeData -TypeName System.Object
```

Expected behavior
-----------------

An error stating that the specified type has no type data associated with it (anymore).

Actual behavior
---------------

```none
Remove-TypeData : Error in TypeData "System.Object": The type "System.Object" was not found. 
The type name value must be the full name of the type. 
Verify the type name and run the command again.
```

Environment data
----------------

```powershell
PowerShell Core v6.0.1 on macOS 10.13.3
PowerShell Core v6.0.1 on Ubuntu 16.04.3 LTS
PowerShell Core v6.0.1 on Microsoft Windows 10 Pro (64-bit; v10.0.15063)
Windows PowerShell v5.1.15063.674 on Microsoft Windows 10 Pro (64-bit; v10.0.15063)
```
title: Remove-TypeData: error message for an extant type that happens to have no type data is misleading
